meanings.sent1: I used some shinola to make my shoes shiny.
meanings.sent2: Mom bought a new bottle of shinola for my leather shoes.
meanings.sent3: Don't mistake the shinola for the ketchup!
meanings.sent4: Her shoes were so polished, they gleamed like shinola under the sun.
meanings.sent5: The smell of shinola always reminds me of my grandfather's shoes.

meanings.sent1: The dog left some shinola on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: Please clean up after your pet if they leave shinola in the park.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally stepped in shinola while walking in the park.
meanings.sent4: The smell in the bathroom was so bad, it was like a pile of shinola.
meanings.sent5: The toddler thought it was funny to play with shinola in the sandbox.

meanings.definition: A slang term for nonsense or something of little value.
meanings.sent1: Don't believe everything he says; it's just shinola.
meanings.sent2: She realized the necklace she bought was just shinola.
meanings.sent3: His excuse for being late was pure shinola.
meanings.sent4: The advertisement was full of shinola, promising things it couldn't deliver.
meanings.sent5: The old watch turned out to be shinola, not worth a penny.
